clinical_study.brief_title: Cancer Care Coordination for Chemotherapy Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Use of mHealth to Support Nurse-directed Care Coordination for Chemotherapy Patients: Improving Health, Healthcare Delivery, and Healthcare Utilization.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare nurse-led care coordination for persons receiving cancer chemotherapy treatment incorporating mobile health technology to nurse-led care coordination without any mobile health enhancements.

secondary_outcome.measure: Demonstration of a HIPAA-compliant platform to coordinate care overtime
secondary_outcome.description: Technology Usability and Acceptance Patient engagement with technology Use of electronic medical record features to communicate with providers

other_outcome.description: Treatment related symptoms Psychological Distress Quality of Life
Processes of care coordination Patient engagement Patient satisfaction
Emergency department visits Unplanned hospitalizations Unplanned clinic visits
Guided interviews with technology group to assess understanding and usability of the mobile technology platform to communicate and coordinate care

arm_group.description: Care coordination using mHealth technology enhancements

intervention.description: Participants receive care coordination throughout their chemotherapy treatment using mHealth technology
Participants receive the same evidence-based care coordination without mHealth technology

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years or older
- Newly diagnosed cancer - any site or stage
- Initiating chemotherapy
- Ability to read and write English
- Manual dexterity sufficient to use a tablet technology
- Cognitive capacity to participate
- Preferential recruitment of publicly insured and/or living in rural communities
Exclusion Criteria:
- Oral chemotherapy
